transferred out of the `_from` account (see \"Approval\" section of the standard). MUST revert if `_to` is the zero address. MUST revert if length of `_ids` is not the same as length of `_values`. MUST revert if any of the balance(s) of the holder(s) for token(s) in `_ids` is lower than the respective amount(s) in `_values` sent to the recipient. MUST revert on any other error. MUST emit `TransferSingle` or `TransferBatch` event(s) such that all the balance changes are reflected (see \"Safe Transfer Rules\" section of the standard). Balance changes and events MUST follow the ordering of the arrays (_ids[0]/_values[0] before _ids[1]/_values[1], etc). After the above conditions for the transfer(s) in the batch are met, this function MUST check if `_to` is a smart contract (e.g. code size > 0). If so, it MUST call the relevant `ERC1155TokenReceiver` hook(s) on `_to` and act appropriately (see \"Safe Transfer Rules\" section of the standard).","params":{"_data":"Additional data with no specified format, MUST be sent unaltered in call to the `ERC1155TokenReceiver` hook(s) on `_to`","_from":"Source address","_ids":"IDs of each token type (order and length must match _values array)","_to":"Target address","_values":"Transfer amounts per token type (order and length must match _ids array)"}},"safeTransferFrom(address,address,uint256,uint256,bytes)":{"details":"Caller must be approved to manage the tokens being transferred out of the `_from` account (see \"Approval\" section of the standard). MUST revert if `_to` is the zero address. MUST revert if balance of holder for token `_id` is lower than the `_value` sent. MUST revert on any other error. MUST emit the `TransferSingle` event to reflect the balance change (see \"Safe Transfer Rules\" section of the standard). After the above conditions are met, this function MUST check if `_to` is a smart contract (e.g. code size > 0). If so, it MUST call `onERC1155Received` on `_to` and act appropriately (see \"Safe Transfer Rules\" section of the standard).","params":{"_data":"Additional data with no specified format, MUST be sent unaltered in call to `onERC1155Received` on `_to`","_from":"Source address","_id":"ID of the token type","_to":"Target address","_value":"Transfer amount"}},"setApprovalForAll(address,bool)":{"details":"MUST emit the ApprovalForAll event on success.","params":{"_approved":"True if the operator is approved, false to revoke approval","_operator":"Address to add to the set of authorized operators"}},"transferControl(uint256,address)":{"params":{"_id":"The token ID.","_newController":"The new token controller."}},"updateMetadata(uint256,string,string,string,address)":{"params":{"_URI":"The part's new URI","_actor":"The account of the entity executing the production process","_id":"The token ID.","_serialNumber":"The part's new serial number.","_status":"The part's new status"}}}},"userdoc":{"methods":{"addController(uint256,address)":{"notice":"Assigns control over a token to another account. MUST revert if sender is not a controller for the token."},"balanceOf(address,uint256)":{"notice":"Get the balance of an account's Tokens."},"balanceOfBatch(address[],uint256[])":{"notice":"Get the balance of multiple account/token pairs"},"burnTokenBalance(uint256,uint256,address)":{"notice":"Burns the specified `_quantity` of a token with an `_id` from an `_actor` account. MUST revert if sender is not a controller for the token. MUST revert if operator does not have the sufficient balance of that token."},"craft(uint256[],uint256[],uint256,string,address,string)":{"notice":"Burns the `_inputQuantities` of the `_inputIds` in the `operator` account.  Token control is given to the message sender.Creates a specified `_outputInitialSupply` of a new token with the next available `_id` and gives it to the `operator`.The control over the token is assigned to the message sender.Emits a specified `_uri`, `_serialNumber`, and a generic \"crafted\" status as well as information about the crafting procedure. MUST revert if number of input ids and number of specified input quantities are not equal. MUST revert if operator does not have sufficient inventory for every input token. MUST emit a craft event. MUST emit a status event. MUST emit a serialNumber event if the parts serial number is specified MUST emit a URI event if a uri for part production information is specified. After the above conditions are met, this function MUST check if `_to` is a smart contract (e.g. code size > 0). If so, it MUST call `onERC1155Received` on `_to` and act appropriately (see \"Safe Transfer Rules\" section of the standard)."},"create(uint256,string,string,address)":{"notice":"Creates a specified `_initialSupply` of new token with the next available `_id` and gives it to the message sender.Token control is given to the message sender.Emits a specified `_uri`, `_serialNumber`, and a generic \"created\" status as well as information about the creation process. No conditions apply. After the above conditions are met, this function MUST check if `_to` is a smart contract (e.g. code size > 0). If so, it MUST call `onERC1155Received` on `_to` and act appropriately (see \"Safe Transfer Rules\" section of the standard)."},"isApprovedForAll(address,address)":{"notice":"Queries the approval status of an operator for a given owner."},"isController(uint256,address)":{"notice":"Returns whether a candidate is a controller of a token"},"newSerialNumber(uint256,string,address)":{"notice":"Updates the serial number of a part by emitting a serialNumber event with a specified _serialNumber for the part's token _id. MUST revert if sender is not a controller for the token. MUST emit a serialNumber event if the _serialNumber length is <0."},"newStatus(uint256,string,address)":{"notice":"Updates the status of a part by emitting a status event with a specified _status for the part's token _id. MUST revert if sender is not a controller for the token. MUST emit a status event if the status length is <0."},"newURI(uint256,string,address)":{"notice":"Updates the URI of a part by emitting a URI event with a specified _URI for the part's token _id. MUST revert if sender is not a controller for the token. MUST emit a URI event if the URI length is <0."},"renounceControl(uint256)":{"notice":"Strips control over a token from the sender account. MUST revert if sender is not a controller for the token."},"safeBatchTransferFrom(address,address,uint256[],uint256[],bytes)":{"notice":"Transfers `_values` amount(s) of `_ids` from the `_from` address to the `_to` address specified (with safety call)."},"safeTransferFrom(address,address,uint256,uint256,bytes)":{"notice":"Transfers `_value` amount of an `_id` from the `_from` address to the `_to` address specified (with safety call)."},"setApprovalForAll(address,bool)":{"notice":"Enable or disable approval for a third party (\"operator\") to manage all of the caller's tokens."},"supportsInterface(bytes4)":{"notice":"Remained from sample implementation for ERC1155 complianceReturn true if the the contract supports the specified interface, else refers to the parent contract."},"transferControl(uint256,address)":{"notice":"Assigns control over a token to another account and strips the senders account of the controlling rights. MUST revert if sender is not a controller for the token."},"updateMetadata(uint256,string,string,string,address)":{"notice":"Combines all three metadata functions. MUST revert if sender is not a controller for the token. MUST emit a URI event if the _URI length is <0. MUST emit a status event if the _status length is <0. MUST emit a serialNumber event if the _serialNumber length is <0."}}}},"settings":{"compilationTarget":{"/home/conner/coding/Ethereum/Blockchain_Codes/DApp_vue/contracts/APTSC.sol":"APTSC"},"evmVersion":"istanbul","libraries":{},"optimizer":{"enabled":false,"runs":200},"remappings":[]},"sources":{"/home/conner/coding/Ethereum/Blockchain_Codes/DApp_vue/contracts/APTSC.sol":{"keccak256":"0x778277881a7375937fcdce6510af8f244bedfdd9b5bba31c4ed828277c03de6a","urls":["bzz-raw://822f18482fc32e7925a1d3d1e6396e7deb76172b1074db48242590dedef0625f","dweb:/ipfs/QmZbgt3BRiZWAME6cUng6EF9DcZYfFg2KFXvkZJ5pVY6Yy"]},"/home/conner/coding/Ethereum/Blockchain_Codes/DApp_vue/contracts/Address.sol":{"keccak256":"0x016260fe1d6f563acefd8adb335b05e569b4026e3f8d472c3e855412debb83de","urls":["bzz-raw://701be90d29a315d87757399639b99315e37db64fd8e2157b27888061edebb7ca","dweb:/ipfs/QmfLFj4eVtsF3V3LaxyKe6ZaGkwpR8ip1NV44WaHQ3BV1g"]},"/home/conner/coding/Ethereum/Blockchain_Codes/DApp_vue/contracts/Common.sol":{"keccak256":"0x900d50cdfedbcf60e9e1ef727674ead98b35abf5a01714ed285989d410c01db8","urls":["bzz-raw://9903b443608607b5f94e85f77d35528baf9adb8c7acc70bc0818437a251f4c8b","dweb:/ipfs/QmRHVoDnjh7ihKZJCXbsVwMEodGEtKBE1wJcvxqkqec2R2"]},"/home/conner/coding/Ethereum/Blockchain_Codes/DApp_vue/contracts/ERC1155.sol":{"keccak256":"0x0302da98d3167b9f9b27d99d274288ab518a848d87d3095413e6383ccc5cd8bf","urls":["bzz-raw://d7c192ca7af32d6fab4aa86eab3e47edf933d6544e2757f0b364bdfd15a1e6c0","dweb:/ipfs/QmeCRr4DToEuQ561qALT9z6Cvt4zk3Yd1167P67dscDgSZ"]},"/home/conner/coding/Ethereum/Blockchain_Codes/DApp_vue/contracts/ERC165.sol":{"keccak256":"0x70660c2c79f0ce447bf70065ef2d3762e0e87198879c2f6fbe75f04b25dd1ddd","urls":["bzz-raw://a4708cdc3840887ec63c82fdf9e2d74fec8b811ccdff18a04a07e15837221b70","dweb:/ipfs/QmYQAbcWu8jREJg3S2ZqeRNCCp6su2ysqgzDTUYAdrvWfc"]},"/home/conner/coding/Ethereum/Blockchain_Codes/DApp_vue/contracts/IERC1155.sol":{"keccak256":"0x4040c1b2dce65b128300d94cba23f79d978e89ddc784c97240bcb9a14334aacf","urls":["bzz-raw://7f2b396be64119cf6b5428f54f5360b53b84c11738590e2 params._owner: The address of the token holder

balanceOf(address,uint256).return: The _owner's balance of the Token type requested

params._owners: The addresses of the token holders

balanceOfBatch(address[],uint256[]).return: The _owner's balance of the Token types requested (i.e. balance for each (owner, id) pair)

params._actor: The account of the entity executing the burning process

params._uri: Link to the parts production data

safeBatchTransferFrom(address,address,ui.details: Caller must be approved to manage the tokens being transferred out of the `_from` account (see "Approval" section of the standard). MUST revert if `_to` is the zero address. MUST revert if length of `_ids` is not the same as length of `_values`. MUST revert if any of the balance(s) of the holder(s) for token(s) in `_ids` is lower than the respective amount(s) in `_values` sent to the recipient. MUST revert on any other error. MUST emit `TransferSingle` or `TransferBatch` event(s) such that all the balance changes are reflected (see "Safe Transfer Rules" section of the standard). Balance changes and events MUST follow the ordering of the arrays (_ids[0]/_values[0] before _ids[1]/_values[1], etc). After the above conditions for the transfer(s) in the batch are met, this function MUST check if `_to` is a smart contract (e.g. code size > 0). If so, it MUST call the relevant `ERC1155TokenReceiver` hook(s) on `_to` and act appropriately (see "Safe Transfer Rules" section of the standard).

params._data: Additional data with no specified format, MUST be sent unaltered in call to the `ERC1155TokenReceiver` hook(s) on `_to`
params._ids: IDs of each token type (order and length must match _values array)
params._values: Transfer amounts per token type (order and length must match _ids array)

safeTransferFrom(address,address,uint256.details: Caller must be approved to manage the tokens being transferred out of the `_from` account (see "Approval" section of the standard). MUST revert if `_to` is the zero address. MUST revert if balance of holder for token `_id` is lower than the `_value` sent. MUST revert on any other error. MUST emit the `TransferSingle` event to reflect the balance change (see "Safe Transfer Rules" section of the standard). After the above conditions are met, this function MUST check if `_to` is a smart contract (e.g. code size > 0). If so, it MUST call `onERC1155Received` on `_to` and act appropriately (see "Safe Transfer Rules" section of the standard).

params._data: Additional data with no specified format, MUST be sent unaltered in call to `onERC1155Received` on `_to`

setApprovalForAll(address,bool).details: MUST emit the ApprovalForAll event on success.

params._approved: True if the operator is approved, false to revoke approval
params._operator: Address to add to the set of authorized operators

params._actor: The account of the entity executing the production process

addController(uint256,address).notice: Assigns control over a token to another account. MUST revert if sender is not a controller for the token.

balanceOf(address,uint256).notice: Get the balance of an account's Tokens.

balanceOfBatch(address[],uint256[]).notice: Get the balance of multiple account/token pairs

burnTokenBalance(uint256,uint256,address.notice: Burns the specified `_quantity` of a token with an `_id` from an `_actor` account. MUST revert if sender is not a controller for the token. MUST revert if operator does not have the sufficient balance of that token.

craft(uint256[],uint256[],uint256,string.notice: Burns the `_inputQuantities` of the `_inputIds` in the `operator` account.  Token control is given to the message sender.Creates a specified `_outputInitialSupply` of a new token with the next available `_id` and gives it to the `operator`.The control over the token is assigned to the message sender.Emits a specified `_uri`, `_serialNumber`, and a generic "crafted" status as well as information about the crafting procedure. MUST revert if number of input ids and number of specified input quantities are not equal. MUST revert if operator does not have sufficient inventory for every input token. MUST emit a craft event. MUST emit a status event. MUST emit a serialNumber event if the parts serial number is specified MUST emit a URI event if a uri for part production information is specified. After the above conditions are met, this function MUST check if `_to` is a smart contract (e.g. code size > 0). If so, it MUST call `onERC1155Received` on `_to` and act appropriately (see "Safe Transfer Rules" section of the standard).

create(uint256,string,string,address).notice: Creates a specified `_initialSupply` of new token with the next available `_id` and gives it to the message sender.Token control is given to the message sender.Emits a specified `_uri`, `_serialNumber`, and a generic "created" status as well as information about the creation process. No conditions apply. After the above conditions are met, this function MUST check if `_to` is a smart contract (e.g. code size > 0). If so, it MUST call `onERC1155Received` on `_to` and act appropriately (see "Safe Transfer Rules" section of the standard).

isApprovedForAll(address,address).notice: Queries the approval status of an operator for a given owner.

isController(uint256,address).notice: Returns whether a candidate is a controller of a token

newSerialNumber(uint256,string,address).notice: Updates the serial number of a part by emitting a serialNumber event with a specified _serialNumber for the part's token _id. MUST revert if sender is not a controller for the token. MUST emit a serialNumber event if the _serialNumber length is <0.

newStatus(uint256,string,address).notice: Updates the status of a part by emitting a status event with a specified _status for the part's token _id. MUST revert if sender is not a controller for the token. MUST emit a status event if the status length is <0.

newURI(uint256,string,address).notice: Updates the URI of a part by emitting a URI event with a specified _URI for the part's token _id. MUST revert if sender is not a controller for the token. MUST emit a URI event if the URI length is <0.

renounceControl(uint256).notice: Strips control over a token from the sender account. MUST revert if sender is not a controller for the token.

safeBatchTransferFrom(address,address,ui.notice: Transfers `_values` amount(s) of `_ids` from the `_from` address to the `_to` address specified (with safety call).

safeTransferFrom(address,address,uint256.notice: Transfers `_value` amount of an `_id` from the `_from` address to the `_to` address specified (with safety call).

setApprovalForAll(address,bool).notice: Enable or disable approval for a third party ("operator") to manage all of the caller's tokens.

supportsInterface(bytes4).notice: Remained from sample implementation for ERC1155 complianceReturn true if the the contract supports the specified interface, else refers to the parent contract.

transferControl(uint256,address).notice: Assigns control over a token to another account and strips the senders account of the controlling rights. MUST revert if sender is not a controller for the token.

updateMetadata(uint256,string,string,str.notice: Combines all three metadata functions. MUST revert if sender is not a controller for the token. MUST emit a URI event if the _URI length is <0. MUST emit a status event if the _status length is <0. MUST emit a serialNumber event if the _serialNumber length is <0.
